para.para: Library routines used for model creation.

listitem.para: Bcomponent * model_add_component (Bmodel *model, Bstring &id, Bstring &type, Vector3< double > loc)
Adds a component to a model.
Bmodel * model_platonic (Bsymmetry &sym, double radius)
Generates a platonic polyhedron.
Bmodel * model_helix (double radius, double helix_rise, double helix_angle, long ncomp)
Generates a helix model.
Bmodel * model_random (long ncomp, double comp_radius, double max_radius)
Generates components at random non-overlapping locations and with random views.
Bmodel * model_random (long ncomp, double comp_radius, Vector3< double > min, Vector3< double > max)
Generates components at random non-overlapping locations and with random views.
Bmodel * model_random_gaussian (long ncomp, double std)
Generates components at random gaussian-distributed locations and with random views.
Bmodel * model_random_shell (long ncomp, double radius)
Generates random components on a shell.
Bmodel * model_random_shell (long ncomp, double radius, double separation)
Generates random components on a shell.
Bmodel * model_create_shell (long number, double radius, double distance)
Creates a spherical shell point model.
Bmodel * model_create_fibonacci_sphere (long number, double radius)
Creates a Fibonacci sphere point model.
Bmodel * model_create_dodecahedron (double radius, long divisions, double sphere_fraction)
Creates an dodecahedron point model.
Bmodel * model_create_icosahedron (double radius, long divisions, double sphere_fraction)
Creates an icosahedron point model.
Bmodel * model_create_circle (double radius, double z, double distance)
Creates a circle with the given radius, height, and component separation.
Bmodel * model_create_ellipse (Vector3< double > axes, double distance)
Creates an ellipse with given semiaxes and component separation.
Bmodel * model_create_ellipsoid (Vector3< double > axes, double distance)
Creates an ellipsoid with given semiaxes and component separation.
Bmodel * model_create_cylinder (Vector3< double > direction, double radius, double length, double distance)
Creates a cylinder with the given radius, length, and component separation.
Bmodel * model_create_plane (double length, double width, double z, double distance)
Creates a plane with the given length, width, height, and component separation.
Bmodel * model_create_spindle (Vector3< double > direction, double radius, double separation, double packing)
Creates a spindle packed inside a sphere.
Bmodel * model_create_cubic_lattice (Vector3< long > lattice, double separation)
Creates a cubic lattice with the given length, width, height, and component separation.
Bmodel * model_create_hexagonal_lattice (Vector3< long > lattice, double separation)
Creates a hexagonal lattice with the given length, width, height, and component separation.

section.title: Detailed Description
section.para: Library routines used for model creation.

formalpara.title: Author
formalpara.para: Bernard Heymann

formalpara.title: Date
formalpara.para: Created: 20090714
Modified: 20210319

section.title: model_add_component()

para.computeroutput: Bcomponent* model_add_component (Bmodel * model, Bstring & id, Bstring & type, Vector3< double > loc)

para.para: Adds a component to a model.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: Bcomponent* new component. The component is added to the model indicated by the ID, the type and the location given.

section.para: Definition at line 32 of file model_create.cpp.

section.title: model_create_circle()

para.computeroutput: Bmodel* model_create_circle (double radius, double z, double distance)

para.para: Creates a circle with the given radius, height, and component separation.

formalpara.title: Author
formalpara.para: Jonathan Luo

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: Bmodel* new circle model. Find angle associated with separation distance using Law of Cosines.

formalpara.para: Bmodel* new lattice model. The components are placed in a cubic arrangement.

section.title: model_create_hexagonal_lattice()

para.computeroutput: Bmodel* model_create_hexagonal_lattice (Vector3< long > lattice, double separation)

para.para: Creates a hexagonal lattice with the given length, width, height, and component separation.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: Bmodel* new lattice model. The components are placed in a hexagonal arrangement to simulate the most commonly expected close packing.

section.title: model_create_shell()

para.computeroutput: Bmodel* model_create_shell (long number, double radius, double separation)

para.para: Creates a spherical shell point model.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: Bmodel* new shell model. Two of the three arguments need to be given (the other zero). If all three arguments are given, only the radius and distance is used.

section.para: Definition at line 486 of file model_create.cpp.

section.title: model_create_spindle()

para.computeroutput: Bmodel* model_create_spindle (Vector3< double > direction, double radius, double separation, double packing)

para.para: Creates a spindle packed inside a sphere.

section.para:
Parameters
direction
spindle axis direction
radius
sphere radius.
separation
separation distance between successive components.
packing
distance between spindle strands.
Returns
Bmodel* new spindle model.
The spindle starts at the minimum Z-pole of the sphere, winding up along the spherical wall to the other pole, and back down inside the first shell. The process is repeated until the whole sphere is packed.
Definition at line 1259 of file model_create.cpp.

section.para: Definition at line 155 of file model_create.cpp.

section.title: model_platonic()

para.computeroutput: Bmodel* model_platonic (Bsymmetry & sym, double radius)

para.para: Generates a platonic polyhedron.

entry.para: distance of each vertex from origin.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: Bmodel* new model. Polyhedral components are generated on symmetry axes. Symmetry designations supported: T-3 tetrahedron. O-2 truncated octahedron. O-3 cube. O-4 octahedron. I-2 truncated icosahedron. I-3 dodecahedron. I-5 icosahedron.

section.para: Definition at line 83 of file model_create.cpp.

section.title: model_random()[1/2]

para.computeroutput: Bmodel* model_random (long ncomp, double comp_radius, double max_radius)

para.para: Generates components at random non-overlapping locations and with random views.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: Bmodel* new model. If a new component overlaps within an existing component, as defined by the component radius, new random coordinates are generated for it.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: Bmodel* new model. If a new component overlaps within an existing component, as defined by the component radius, new random coordinates are generated for it.

section.para: Definition at line 371 of file model_create.cpp.

section.title: model_random_shell()[2/2]

para.computeroutput: Bmodel* model_random_shell (long ncomp, double radius, double separation)

para.para: Generates random components on a shell.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: Bmodel* new model. The vertices are created with a desired separation, which means that if too many vertices are requested with too large separation, the function may never return. The following must therefore be true: n*(d/r)^2 < 8 where n: number of vertices d: minimum separation distance r: polyhedron radius If this not true, the number of vertices is decreased.

section.para: Definition at line 427 of file model_create.cpp.
